item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Check GMP, Allotment Date, Subscription Status - News18
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO: Check GMP, Allotment Date, Subscription Status

Publication Date: December 14, 2024, 16:35 IST

Source: News18

Unlisted shares of Vishal Mega Mart Ltd are currently trading at Rs 97 per share in the grey market, which is 24.36 per cent higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 78, indicating a decent listing on December 18.

  • The IPO allotment will be finalised on December 16, and the listing on BSE and NSE will occur on December 18.
  • The IPO was available for subscription between December 11 and December 13, receiving an overall subscription of 28.75 times.
  • The retail category saw a 2.43 times subscription, while non-institutional investors portion had a 15.01 times subscription.
  • Qualified institutional buyers subscribed by 85.11 times.
  • The grey market premium (GMP) is currently at 24.36%, indicating solid market interest.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

The IPO of Vishal Mega Mart is entirely an offer-for-sale (OFS) by promoter Kedaara Capital-led Samayat Services LLP, with no fresh issue of equity shares. The IPO collected Rs 2,400 crore from anchor investors before the IPO’s public offering.

item.title: Vishal Mega Mart IPO Highlights: Issue booked 27.28x led by QIBs, NIIs. Check GMP, review, more | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Vishal Mega Mart IPO Highlights: Issue booked 27.28x led by QIBs, NIIs. Check GMP, review, more

Publication Date: 13 Dec, 2024 | Source: HT Digital Streams Limited

Vishal Mega Mart's IPO, valued at ₹8,000 crore, saw significant interest with a subscription rate of 27.28 times on its third day, primarily from Qualified Institutional Buyers (QIBs) and Non-Institutional Investors (NIIs).

  • The IPO was fully subscribed on the second day, achieving a rate of 1.54 times.
  • The retail investor segment saw a subscription of 2.31 times, while NIIs subscribed at 14.25 times.
  • QIBs led the charge with a staggering 80.75 times subscription rate.
  • Vishal Mega Mart aims for a market valuation of approximately ₹36,120 crore if shares are priced at ₹78.
  • The price band for the IPO is between ₹74 and ₹78 per equity share.
  • The supermarket chain is focused on growth in tier-2 cities with plans to expand its retail presence across India.
"The IPO offers an attractive valuation at 76x FY24 PE, making it relatively affordable compared to industry peers." - Gaurav Garg, Research Analyst at Lemonn Markets Desk.

This robust response from investors highlights growing confidence in Vishal Mega Mart’s potential amidst a dynamic retail landscape. The IPO has attracted significant attention and is seen as a promising opportunity for investors.

item.title: Bihari sattu roti to Manipur's black rice pudding: Recreate Vikas Khanna's Bungalow menu for Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bihari sattu roti to Manipur's black rice pudding: Recreate Vikas Khanna's Bungalow menu for Jeff Bezos, Lauren Sanchez

Date: Dec 14, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

Amazon's Jeff Bezos recently dined at Vikas Khanna's Michelin-star restaurant, Bungalow, in New York, where he experienced a carefully curated desi fusion meal with partner Lauren Sanchez, describing it as a 'pilgrimage'.

  • The meal featured a variety of dishes, including Bengali Kasundi Tandoori Avocado and Indore-inspired Dahi Kebab.
  • Notable desserts included Gulab Jamun ice cream paired with millet chocolate cake.
  • The article provides recipes for three dishes: Bihari Sattu Roti, Indore's Dahi Kebabs, and Black Rice Pudding from Manipur.
A 'pilgrimage' — that's what Jeff Bezos called Vikas Khanna's carefully curated desi fusion meal for him and partner Lauren Sanchez.

Overall, the menu reflects a blend of traditional Indian flavors with innovative techniques, inviting readers to recreate this unique dining experience at home.

item.title: "To Me, It's A Black Mark": KM Birla On Losing "Cool" 18 Times In 29 Years - NDTV
item.description:
To Me, It's A Black Mark: KM Birla On Losing "Cool" 18 Times In 29 Years

Publication Date: Not Specified
Source: Not Specified

Zerodha co-founder Nikhil Kamath interviews Kumar Mangalam Birla, the chairman of Aditya Birla Group, in the upcoming episode of his podcast 'People By WTF', where Birla reveals he has lost his cool 18 times in 29 years.

  • Nikhil Kamath will host Kumar Mangalam Birla in his podcast series.
  • Birla admits to losing his temper 18 times in nearly three decades.
  • The podcast episode is expected to cover various topics of interest.
  • Birla references the limited availability of his interviews over the years.
  • Social media users express excitement for the upcoming episode.
"I have lost it 18 times in 29 years. To me, it is a black mark, especially at work." - Kumar Mangalam Birla

As anticipation builds for the podcast episode, it offers a rare glimpse into the thoughts of one of India's business titans.

item.title: Section of Akasa Air pilots flags concerns over unfair practices; airline terms allegations untrue - The Economic Times
item.description:
Section of Akasa Air pilots flags concerns over unfair practices; airline terms allegations untrue

Publication Date: Dec 14, 2024, 09:01:00 PM IST

Source: PTI

A section of Akasa Air pilots has raised concerns about alleged training and safety issues at the airline and sought the intervention of the civil aviation ministry, while the carrier termed the allegations as untrue.

  • Akasa Air faces allegations of training lapses and safety issues, with pilots requesting a probe.
  • The airline disputes these claims, stating that 324 pilots have joined since October 2023 and attrition is below 1%.
  • 84 pilots reportedly resigned on short notice, prompting concerns among remaining staff.
  • The DGCA imposed a Rs 30 lakh fine on Akasa Air for previous training lapses.
  • The airline operates 26 planes and serves 27 destinations, including five overseas cities.
"We categorically deny these allegations as baseless and untrue. Nor do they represent the views of Akasa pilots," - Airline spokesperson.

Despite the concerns raised, Akasa Air maintains that its monthly employee surveys indicate high job satisfaction among pilots, countering the allegations about unfair practices.

item.title: SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
SARFAESI | Confirmed Sale Can't Be Set Aside For Mere Irregularities Except Fraud, Collusion, Inadequate...

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Not specified

The Supreme Court recently clarified the grounds under which a sale of property under the SARFAESI Act can be challenged after confirmation, emphasizing that only fundamental errors like fraud or collusion are valid reasons for setting aside a sale.

  • The Court held that procedural irregularities alone cannot invalidate a confirmed sale.
  • Only substantial procedural errors such as fraud, collusion, or inadequate pricing warrant intervention.
  • Legal challenges should ideally be raised before the confirmation of the sale.
  • The judgment referenced V.S. Palanivel v. P. Sriram, reinforcing that courts should avoid setting aside auctions unless serious flaws are identified.
  • The case involved a minor procedural point regarding the gap between sale and auction notices, which was insufficient for a successful challenge.
"Any sale by auction or other public procurement methods once already confirmed or concluded ought not to be set-aside or interfered with lightly except on grounds that go to the core of such sale process, such as either being collusive, fraudulent or vitiated by inadequate pricing or underbidding."

In conclusion, the Supreme Court reinforced the stability of confirmed sales under the SARFAESI Act, allowing challenges only in cases of significant procedural shortcomings. This ruling aims to maintain confidence in auction processes and avoid unnecessary disruptions.

item.title: AI should not be outrightly rejected: Supreme Court Justice KV Viswanathan - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
AI should not be outrightly rejected: Supreme Court Justice KV Viswanathan

Published on: 14 Dec 2024, 11:51 am

Supreme Court judge Justice KV Viswanathan emphasized the importance of considering the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in society, stating that it should not be outrightly rejected during a recent event.

  • Justice Viswanathan spoke at the Delhi High Court during the launch of a commentary on Patent Law by advocate Adarsh Ramanujan.
  • He highlighted the commentary's intriguing analysis of AI's relationship with patent law.
  • Justice Manmohan also attended, noting an increase in patent applications at the Indian Patent Office as an encouraging trend.
  • The event included discussions on the significance of identifying invention origins through patenting and the need for better training for patent examiners.

“I don't think that AI should be outrightly rejected. It calls for a certain amount of thought before we take a final call on it,” - Justice KV Viswanathan.

“Patent law is where future lies. It is a growing field that puts the lawyer first,” - Justice Manmohan.

This discussion reflects a growing recognition of the potential and challenges of integrating AI into legal frameworks, while also encouraging innovation in patent law practices in India.

item.title: Dalal Street Week Ahead: Will Nifty extend gains or re-enter consolidation? - The Economic Times
item.description:
Dalal Street Week Ahead: Will Nifty extend gains or re-enter consolidation?

Publication Date: Currently unavailable | Source: ETMarkets.com

The Nifty closed the week with a modest gain, finishing above the critical 24700 resistance level. The continuation of this upward trajectory is dependent on maintaining this level, with a possibility of further gains if sustained.

  • The Nifty had a volatile trading week, ending with a net gain of 90.50 points (+0.37%).
  • India VIX fell by 7.69% to close at 13.05.
  • Key resistance levels for the Nifty are 24790 and 25000, while supports are at 24590 and 24400.
  • Sector performance indicates strong potential for Bank, Financial Services, Private Banks, and IT sectors.
  • The Nifty must hold above 24700 to avoid re-entering a consolidation phase.
“The longer the Nifty stays above 24700, the greater the possibility of this upmove extending itself.”

The upcoming week is expected to be cautious; however, maintaining positions in stronger sectors is advisable as the market may continue to show volatility.

item.title: 'Will work with me, Isha, Akash, Anant...' - Mukesh Ambani announces new HR leader to transform Reliance - Check profile - ET Now
item.description:
Will work with me, Isha, Akash, Anant... - Mukesh Ambani announces new HR leader to transform Reliance - Check profile

Publication Date: Updated Dec 14, 2024 17:48 IST

Source: ET NOW News

Mukesh Ambani has appointed Ira Bindra as the new Group President of People, Leadership, and Talent at Reliance Industries Ltd, marking a pivotal shift in the company’s people policies.

  • Mukesh Ambani appointed Ira Bindra as Group President at Reliance Industries Ltd.
  • Bindra, a graduate of Lady Shri Ram College and an MBA from Maastricht, has a strong background in HR leadership.
  • She aims to integrate business and people strategies to drive transformation across the organization.
"Bindra joins us from Medtronic, USA, where she was the Head of Human Resources & Vice President - Global Regions." - Mukesh Ambani

At 47, Bindra becomes the first non-family woman and youngest member of Reliance's Executive Committee, where she will work closely with Ambani and other leaders to enhance the company’s culture and leadership practices.

Bindra expressed her enthusiasm for the role, stating she looks forward to working with the leadership team to drive transformation in the company. Reliance is currently one of the largest private sector companies in India, ranked 86th on Forbes Global 500.

item.title: Maruti e-Vitara vs Toyota Urban Cruiser EV: Design, Features, Range & More - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Maruti e-Vitara vs Toyota Urban Cruiser EV: Design, Features, Range & More

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: Gaadiwaadi

The article compares the upcoming Maruti e-Vitara and Toyota Urban Cruiser EV, which will be developed at Suzuki’s Gujarat factory and are set to go on sale in India next year.

  1. Both SUVs share a lot of commonalities but differ in appearance, with the Maruti e-Vitara featuring contemporary styling and the Toyota Urban Cruiser EV offering a minimalistic design.
  2. The side profile of both SUVs is similar, with identical rear door handles and a charging socket at the left quarter.
  3. The interior cabin of both SUVs is similar, with different brand badging and upholstery colors. The Maruti e-Vitara has a dual-tone black and brown interior, while the Toyota Urban Cruiser EV features an all-black theme.
  4. Both SUVs will come with features like a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, automatic climate control, wireless Smartphone charging, heads-up display, two-spoke steering wheel, electronic parking brake, multiple drive modes, powered driver’s seat, sunroof, JBL music system, and a 10.1-inch touchscreen infotainment system with Android Auto and Apple CarPlay.
  5. The e-Vitara and Urban Cruiser EV will be offered with a choice between a 49 kWh and a 61 kWh lithium-ion battery, providing a range of 400 km and 500+ km on a single charge, respectively.
“The smaller battery pack is believed to offer a range of 400 km on a single charge while the bigger battery is expected to provide a range of 500+ km on a full charge.”

The Maruti e-Vitara and Toyota Urban Cruiser EV are highly anticipated electric SUVs set to debut in India, offering a range of advanced features and impressive range options.

item.title: 8 smallcap stocks that touched 52-week high this week, give up to 37% returns - The Economic Times
item.description:
8 smallcap stocks that touched 52-week high this week, give up to 37% returns

Publication Date: Not specified
Source: Economic Times

Amid a market surge, several smallcap stocks reached their 52-week highs this week, achieving returns of up to 37% week-on-week, driven by easing food inflation and positive market sentiment.

  • Centum Electronics: Hit a 52-week high of Rs 2,381.20, with returns of 36.8%.
  • Sunflag Iron And Steel Company: Reached a 52-week high of Rs 280, providing a 27% return.
  • Gokaldas Exports: Achieved a 52-week high of Rs 1,210, gaining 23.4% WoW.
  • Greaves Cotton: Hit a 52-week high of Rs 259.50, yielding 22% returns.
  • Kitex Garments: Saw a 52-week high of Rs 879.10, with 22% weekly returns.
  • Gujarat Industries Power Company: Hit Rs 270, giving 17.2% returns.
  • Indo Count Industries: Reached a 52-week high of Rs 450.45, with nearly 17% returns.
  • Vidhi Specialty Food Ingredients: Achieved a 52-week high of Rs 569.55, yielding 15.5% returns.
“Easing food inflation and a price hike by FMCG companies support the sector to outperform.”

This week's performance of smallcap stocks reflects the positive market environment, with many seeing significant gains as they reach new highs.

item.title: PC Jeweller among 9 stocks with record dates for dividends, bonuses, splits next week. Do you own any? - The Economic Times
item.description:
PC Jeweller among 9 stocks with record dates for dividends, bonuses, splits next week. Do you own any?

Publication Date: December 14, 2023

Source: Economic Times

The shares of PC Jeweller and other companies are expected to gain attention in the upcoming week as they approach record dates for corporate actions such as dividends, bonus shares, and stock splits.

  • PC Jeweller will conduct a stock split from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 1 per share.
  • Shareholders must ensure shares are in their demat accounts by the record date to qualify for the respective benefits.
  • Investors purchasing shares on the ex-date will not be eligible for these benefits.
  • The T+1 settlement framework simplifies tracking eligibility, although market holidays can complicate this.
“The record date is a crucial benchmark set by companies to identify the shareholders entitled to receive benefits such as dividends, stock splits, or bonus shares.”

In conclusion, investors should closely monitor corporate actions as they could impact their returns significantly in the upcoming week.

item.title: Skoda Kylaq Production Begins Ahead Of Deliveries - 10K Bookings In 10 Days - GaadiWaadi.com
item.description:
Skoda Kylaq Production Begins Ahead Of Deliveries - 10K Bookings In 10 Days

Publication Date: December 2024

Source: GaadiWaadi

The production of the Skoda Kylaq has commenced in India, with customer deliveries scheduled to start on January 27, 2025. The vehicle has received a strong market response, with over 10,000 bookings in just ten days.

  • The starting price for the Skoda Kylaq is Rs. 7.89 lakh (ex-showroom) for the base variant.
  • Available in four trim levels: Classic, Signature, Signature+, and Prestige.
  • Customers have five color options: Olive Gold, Tornado Red, Carbon Steel, Brilliant Silver, and Candy White.
  • The Classic trim includes features like six airbags and traction control.
  • Skoda plans to expand its dealership network to 350 outlets by the end of next year.
  • The Kylaq boasts a boot capacity of 446 liters and includes features like climate control and cruise control.
“The response has been overwhelmingly positive with over 10,000 bookings secured within just 10 days.”

In terms of performance, the Skoda Kylaq is powered by a 1.0L three-cylinder turbocharged TSI petrol engine, offering 114 bhp and 178 Nm of torque. Buyers can opt for either a six-speed manual or automatic transmission.

item.title: UPI achieves 15,547 crore transactions worth Rs 223 lakh crore from January to November - The Economic Times
item.description:
UPI achieves 15,547 crore transactions worth Rs 223 lakh crore from January to November

Publication Date: Saturday, November 2023

Source: Finance Ministry (via news article)

New Delhi: The Unified Payments Interface (UPI) has achieved 15,547 crore transactions valued at Rs 223 lakh crore from January to November this year, as reported by the Finance Ministry.

  • UPI showcases its transformative impact on India's financial transactions.
  • Currently operational in seven countries including UAE, Singapore, and France.
  • Launched by NPCI in 2016, UPI has integrated multiple bank accounts into one mobile app.
  • In October 2024, UPI processed 16.58 billion transactions, marking 45% year-on-year growth.
  • India now accounts for around 49% of global real-time payment transactions as of 2023.
"UPI has revolutionised the nation's payment ecosystem by integrating multiple bank accounts into a single mobile application."

UPI has significantly empowered small businesses and individuals, driving the shift towards a cashless economy and demonstrating India's leadership in digital payment innovation.
